chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malik K Hartfield in court via zoom, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Malik K Hartfield.  Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND, which expires 1/17/2023.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Malik K Hartfield.  Attorney Erin Karshen for Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

No spin court is available.  Court orders case adjourned for a scheduling conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malik K Hartfield not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Malik K Hartfield.  Attorney Erin Karshen for Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense remains in trial posture.  Case passed.

Defendant Malik K Hartfield in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Malik K Hartfield.  Attorney Ken Olstinski for Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case remains in trial posture.  State place offer on the record.  

State's Motion to Admit the Forensic Video is addressed.  Court reviewed the forensic video and place thoughts on the record.  Additional statements made.  Court DENIES the motion to admit the video.

Additional preliminary issues addressed.

Court orders case adjourned for Jury Trial on 10/3/2022
received and filed.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Malik K Hartfield not in court, in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. Defendant not produced. Arguments heard as to bail. Court adjusts bail down to $ 25,000.00. Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect. Case remains calendared as previously set. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.
Defense counsel filed a motion for a Bail review and the assistance contacted the court requesting to be heard on bail on 7/15/2022 8:45am.
Received and filed
Signed Scheduling Order
filed.
filed.
filed.
Notice of Expert; filed.
Motion to Admit Forensic Interview; filed.

Defendant Malik K Hartfield in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Malik K Hartfield in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Status Conference.  Court has found the State has satified victims' right law.  Court grants Motion to Withdraw by Attorney Heather L. Johnson made prior to case being called.  Attorney Cleghorn recently retained by Defendant.  Defense has received Discovery and Offer from State.  Defense requested Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Any Motions to be filed by September 1, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 050406,
Payable Number: 1009466,
Receipt Number: 22RP021667,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Malik K Hartfield in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  
Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail bond hearing. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Bail motion by Defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Defense received offer today and in receipt of partial discovery. Case remains calendared before Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Received and Filed. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver

Defendant Malik K Hartfield in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnso; both appear by video.  Defendant Malik K Hartfield in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 15.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GL or DJ.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

11:47 AM Defendant Malik K Hartfield in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Malik K Hartfield in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Malik K Hartfield appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
